summary.span: 提供基底類別，所有要做為辨識項使用的物件都必須衍生自該類別。

span.span: Provides a base class from which all objects to be used as evidence must derive.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 之前[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，幾乎任何物件可用來做為辨識項物件，如果想要套用以辨識項的裝載程式碼。Before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], almost any object could be used as an evidence object if the hosting code wanted to apply it as evidence. 例如，某些.NET Framework 程式碼辨識辨識項的物件。For example, some .NET Framework code recognized objects as evidence. Common language runtime (CLR) 會被視為辨識項物件做為參考，並沒有套用到它們的任何型別安全。The common language runtime (CLR) considered evidence objects as references, and did not apply any type safety to them. 這會顯示問題，因為沒有隱含的類型無法當做辨識項物件的限制。This presented a problem because there were implicit restrictions on which types could be used as evidence objects. 具體而言，辨識項所做的任何物件必須是可序列化的無法`null`。Specifically, any object used as evidence had to be serializable and could not be `null`. 如果未符合這些需求，而 CLR 所需的這些假設其中一個作業執行時，就會發生例外狀況。If these requirements were not met, the CLR threw an exception whenever an operation that required one of these assumptions was performed. 類別，所有的辨識項物件必須衍生自，在引進[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]啟用條件約束上的可用來當做辨識項的物件類型，並提供新功能與需求，加入所有的辨識項的能力物件。The class, which all evidence objects must derive from, was introduced in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] to enable constraints on the types of objects that can be used as evidence and to provide the ability to add new features and requirements to all evidence objects. 類別可確保，在具現化，辨識項物件是可序列化。The class ensures, upon instantiation, that the evidence object is serializable. 此外，也可以藉由新增新的預設實作對基底類別建立新的辨識項需求。In addition, it enables new evidence requirements to be created by adding new default implementations to the base class. 使用 CLR 的辨識項物件中已更新的所有型別[!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]衍生自。All the types used by the CLR as evidence objects have been updated in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] to derive from .
